Prepaire

Step 1.buy a domain-[url=https://www.msly.cn/boards/topic/30/how-to-install-frp-on-home-assistant-operating-systemhassos-on-raspberry-pi-step-by-step/page/2#3757]purchase your own domain name[/url]

Step 2.buy a vps server - for Install NGINX on your vps server

Step 3. domain A to ipv4 address on vps server - your own domain name point to vps server ipv4 address 4. install nginx - Install NGINX on your vps server [url=https://www.msly.cn/boards/topic/3224/how-to-install-and-uninstall-reinstall-nginx-on-raspberry-piraspberry-pi-3b]How To Install and uninstall reinstall Nginx on raspberry pi（raspberry pi 3B+）[/url] [url=https://www.msly.cn/boards/topic/3224/how-to-install-and-uninstall-reinstall-nginx-on-raspberry-piraspberry-pi-3b#3805]test run ok[/url] 5. config nginx for your domain 6.install Let’s Encrypt client certbot - install Let’s Encrypt client certbot for nginx on vps server 7.downloaded SSL certificates for your domain Step 8:frp 8.1 Install frp [url=https://www.msly.cn/boards/topic/30/how-to-install-frp-on-home-assistant-operating-systemhassos-on-raspberry-pi-step-by-step/page/2#3811]8.2.1Configure frp server on vps server[/url] [url=https://www.msly.cn/boards/topic/30/how-to-install-frp-on-home-assistant-operating-systemhassos-on-raspberry-pi-step-by-step/page/1#3467]8.3.1Configure frp client on pi[/url] [url=https://www.msly.cn/boards/topic/30/how-to-install-frp-on-home-assistant-operating-systemhassos-on-raspberry-pi-step-by-step#3678]8.3.2 Start frp Client on pi[/url]
[b]Scenario[/b]
          • Access to HA via browser is OK
          • Access to HA via HA App is Not OK - results in “Unable to Connect” error message
[b]Background[/b]
          • Platform: Android (Samsung Galaxy S22 Ultra, Android v12)
          • Browser: Chrome/Samsung
          • Home Assistant Server: latest (2022.3.7)
          • Home Assistant companion app: latest (2022.3.0-full)
          • Access to HA is via Cloudflared/Argo tunnel
          • HA is behind Nginx Proxy Manager
[b]Checklist[/b]
          • Cloudflare Zero trust cannot be used with the app
          • Make sure your homeassistant: settings are right, e.g.
  external_url: "https://ha.YOURDOMAIN.org"
  internal_url: "http://YOURLANIP:8123"
          • Also ensure your http: settings are right, e.g.
http:
  use_x_forwarded_for: true
  trusted_proxies:
    - 172.30.33.0/24  # Add the IP address of the proxy server
    - 192.168.2.0/24
[b]Solution[/b]
          • The issue was not with cloudfare, nginx or HA
          • The issue was resolved by disabling private DNS on the phone
[b]Disabling Private DNS[/b] Settings → Connections → More Connection Settings → Private DNS → Set to OFF Hope this helps someone
